author: Brian Platt, Derek Decloet
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney confirmed Canada is considering joining the US in its “Golden Dome” missile defense project, but declined to put a price tag on it and said the talks are at an early stage.
title: Carney Says Canada, US Are in ‘High Level’ Talks on Golden Dome Defense System

author: John Harney, Patrick Clark
description: President Donald Trump said Wednesday evening that he was “giving very serious consideration” to taking the mortgage giants Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae public after more than a decade of being under government oversight.
title: Trump Considers Taking Freddie Mac, Fannie Mae Public

author: Daniel Flatley, Toru Fujioka
description: US Secretary Scott Bessent and Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato did not discuss foreign exchange levels during a meeting in Canada, according to a statement from the Treasury Department. The news sent the yen lower.
title: Bessent, Kato Did Not Discuss FX Levels at G-7, US Says

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump has always had strong opinions about the planes used as Air Force One, from their price to their baby-blue color scheme. Frustrated with the growing costs and delays associated with the Boeing Co.’s development of new presidential jetliners, Trump is turning to an unlikely alternative for his next ride: the Middle Eastern nation of Qatar, which has offered him a luxury Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet.
title: Why Trump Wants a $400 Million Airplane Rife With Risks

author: Erica Yokoyama, Eddy Duan
description: During Japan’s Edo period, feudal lords were warned that peasant revolts start with rice. Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is finding political survival can still hinge on the price of the staple food.
title: Rice Costs Imperil Ishiba After Bragging Minister Quits in Japan

author: Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump holds up a printed article from "American Thinker" while accusing South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa of state-sanctioned violence against white farmers in South Africa in the Oval Office at the White House on May 21.
title: Prized Oval Office Visits With Trump Become Perilous Tests of Nerve

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this week’s episode of Trumponomics, we look at how the US president’s recent trip to the region was a big win for Middle East oil states.
title: Why Trump Is Good News for Gulf Nations

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the 11th-hour wrangling over the Republican tax-cut plan. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Tax Bill Still Has ‘Long Way to Go’ in the House

author: Fares Alghoul
description: Dozens of aid trucks began entering the Gaza Strip for the first time since Israel blocked supplies to the beleaguered territory 80 days ago, according to witnesses and transport companies.
title: Aid Trucks Enter Gaza for First Time in 80 Days

author: Zach C Cohen
description: For as long as Americans have paid federal income taxes, they’ve been able to subtract some of what they pay to their state and local governments from their taxable income. This federal deduction for state and local taxes — the SALT deduction, for short — has a big influence on how the tax burden is divided. It tends to help taxpayers in wealthier, more urban states, where sales taxes are higher and real estate costs more.
title: Republicans Have a SALT Tax Deal. Who Will Benefit?

author: Angelina Rascouet
description: Bernard Arnault urged the European Union to hold constructive talks with the US as the French billionaire questioned the course of current negotiations.
title: Arnault Urges EU to Hold Constructive Talks With US on Tariffs

author: Fabiola Zerpa
description: Walt Disney Co. notified Florida-based employees who are losing temporary legal residency in the US that their jobs would be terminated next month after the Supreme Court ruled Monday that the Trump administration could revoke protections for 350,000 Venezuelans.
title: Disney Suspends Venezuelan Workers on Supreme Court Ruling

author: Eric Martin
description: America’s top diplomat signaled that accusing Russia’s President Vladimir Putin of war crimes in Ukraine could undermine President Donald Trump’s efforts to negotiate an end to the conflict.
title: Rubio Signals Labeling Putin War Criminal Would Hurt Peace Talks

author: Netty Idayu Ismail
description: Malaysia’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said the US pledged to “sympathetically” review its appeal for lower tariffs even as the Southeast Asian nation seeks to strengthen its ties with Washington’s top competitor China.
title: Malaysia’s Anwar Says US Trade Talks Unaffected by China Ties

author: Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei will cut energy subsidies for all gated communities in the greater Buenos Aires region, a move that will hit a portion of Argentina’s upper class that for years has been paying a fraction of their gas and electric bills.
title: Rich Argentines Face Higher Energy Bills After Milei Subsidy Cut

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain and Portugal have called on the European Union to accelerate the completion of a cross-border power connection with the Iberian Peninsula after a recent blackout highlighted risks for the region’s electricity supply.
title: Spain, Portugal Urge EU Effort on Power Link After Blackout

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: Democratic Commissioner Kristin Johnson plans to step down from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission later this year, the latest of several high-profile departures at the regulator.
title: Third CFTC Commissioner to Resign Amid Wave of Departures

author: Deana Kjuka
description: Moscow’s mayor said 18 drones had been intercepted flying toward the capital Wednesday as travelers faced disruption at airports that were forced to suspend operations.
title: Moscow Intercepts 18 Drones With Airports Suspending Operations

author: S'thembile Cele
description: President Donald Trump rejected South African President Cyril Ramaphosa’s argument that there’s no genocide against White Afrikaners, airing a video and showing images in the Oval Office that he said showed how they were beaten and killed.
title: Trump Insists Afrikaners Face Genocide in Heated Meeting

author: William Horobin
description: France’s finance chief Eric Lombard said the Group of Seven can make progress on resolving differences with the US on divisive issues including trade, even if officials meeting over the next two days fail to deliver a final communique.
title: France’s Lombard Eyes Progress With US at G-7, Even Without a Communique

author: Courtney McBride, Leen Al-Rashdan
description: The Defense Department formally accepted a luxury Boeing Co. 747-8 jumbo jet from Qatar to temporarily serve as the new Air Force One for President Donald Trump, one of the biggest foreign gifts ever given to the US government.
title: US Accepts Qatar Luxury Jet as Trump’s New Air Force One

author: Michael Shepard, Edward Ludlow
description: The Trump administration will maintain efforts to keep advanced artificial intelligence technology out of China’s hands, a top White House official said, brushing off calls from Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang to ease restrictions on chip exports to the world’s second largest economy.
title: US to Keep China Chip Curbs, Spurning Nvidia’s Call for Relief

author: David Voreacos
description: LaMonica McIver, a New Jersey Congresswoman, made a court appearance Wednesday to face felony charges accusing her of assaulting US immigration officers as she tried to prevent the city’s mayor from being arrested outside a private detention facility.
title: Congresswoman Appears in Court on Assault Case at ICE Facility

author: Patrick Sykes, Ethan Bronner, Anthony Capaccio
description: The conflict between Israel and Iran has shaped the Middle East for decades. It was largely on a low boil as the two sides attacked each other — mostly quietly and in Iran’s case often by proxy — while avoiding a full-blown war.
title: Why Rising Israel-Iran Tensions Threaten to Boil Over

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz for the first time publicly advocated spending up to 5% of the German economy on defense.
title: Merz Sees Germany on NATO Path to 5% Goal Defense Spending

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania’s interim president said a government lacking a parliamentary majority may need to push through urgent reforms if parties don’t set aside differences and forge a broader pro-European coalition.
title: Romanian Leader Says Minority Coalition May Need to Push Reforms

author: Jonathan Gilbert
description: President Javier Milei’s vow to unleash Argentina’s beleaguered farmers is faltering after a decision to raise taxes on soy exports by about seven percentage points.
title: Milei Stumbles in Bid to Unchain Farmers as Soy Tax Break Ends

author: Fumbuka Ng'Wanakilala
description: Tanzania restricted internet access after several government accounts on the X social network platform were compromised.
title: Tanzania Curbs Internet After X Posts Fake President’s Death

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Iceye Oy, the Finnish maker of advanced Earth-observation satellites, plans further investments in Poland as it sees increased demand from countries that want to improve their intelligence-gathering capabilities in space.
title: Space Startup Iceye Boosts Poland Investment to Meet Army Demand

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Trump administration has asked the US Supreme Court to halt a judge’s order that would force it to answer questions and turn over documents about Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency in a fight over public access to the office’s records.
title: DOGE Asks US Supreme Court to Block Access to Its Records

author: Erik Wasson, Jack Fitzpatrick
description: Conservative hardliners threatened to block Republicans’ massive tax and spending package, jeopardizing passage of President Donald Trump’s signature economic legislation.
title: Republican Hardliners Threaten to Block Deal on Trump Tax Bill

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: Republicans on the Senate Banking Committee are probing two top proxy advisory firms over potential political bias and conflicts of interest, in a renewed push to subject the industry to greater oversight.
title: GOP Senators Scrutinize Proxy Advisers Over Potential Conflicts

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union was expected to share a revised trade proposal with the US, as it aims to inject momentum in talks with President Donald Trump’s administration amid lingering skepticism that a transatlantic deal can be reached.
title: EU Prepares Trade Proposal for US to Steer Momentum Into Talks

author: Fadwa Hodali, Alisa Odenheimer
description: Israeli soldiers mistakenly fired warning shots at diplomats representing the European Union, UK, China, Russia and other countries on Wednesday.
title: Israel Fired Warning Shots at EU, China Diplomats by Mistake

author: James Herron
description: Russia will defend its vessels in the Baltic Sea by all legal means, the Kremlin said, days after briefly deploying a fighter jet as Estonian officials tried to halt a so-called shadow fleet tanker in their economic zone.
title: Kremlin Vows to Defend Its Ships in the Baltic by All Legal Ways

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Myles Miller
description: The Trump administration is filing criminal charges against more immigrants in the US illegally as part of an effort to skirt state and city policies that limit local cooperation.
title: Trump Ramps Up Criminal Charges Against Migrants in California

author: Erik Wasson, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: House Republicans leaders are planning to accelerate new Medicaid work requirements to December 2026 in a deal with ultra-conservatives on the giant tax bill, according to a lawmaker familiar with the discussions.
title: Tax Bill Set to Bring Forward Medicaid Work Requirements to 2026

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy is just two days away from the chance to start shaking off the near-junk status that has hung over Giorgia Meloni’s premiership.
title: Meloni Looks to Moody’s to Finally End Italy’s Near-Junk Status

author: S'thembile Cele, Loni Prinsloo
description: Elon Musk will join President Donald Trump’s meeting with South African leader Cyril Ramaphosa at the White House on Wednesday.
title: Musk to Join Trump for Meeting With South Africa’s Ramaphosa

author: Dan Williams
description: A US media outlet reports that Israel may be poised to strike Iran’s nuclear sites and oil markets wince. In Washington, a Republican administration wonders if Tehran is more determined or deterred.
title: Sputtering Iran-US Talks Revive Specter of Israeli Solo Strike

author: Olga Kharif
description: A dinner on Thursday in Washington — billed as the “Most Exclusive Once in Lifetime Invitation” — is the latest and boldest spectacle Bill Zanker has launched for Donald Trump.
title: Trump’s Old Partner Sells Memecoins, Cologne and Access

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Russian forces in Ukraine have made only small territorial gains this year amid steady resistance from Kyiv’s military, undercutting President Vladimir Putin’s assertions that his army has gained the upper hand in the war.
title: Russian Advance in Ukraine Is Slowing Despite Putin’s Confidence

author: Jonas Ekblom
description: Sweden’s government faces a political backlash after several ministers were found to own stock in sectors they decide on, further tarnishing the Nordic image of low corruption after a similar scandal in neighboring Norway.
title: Swedish Ministers Face Pressure Over Undeclared Shareholdings

author: Michael Cohen
description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana presented a third version of the national budget to lawmakers in Cape Town on Wednesday after months of wrangling over tax increases.
title: Winners and Losers in South Africa’s Latest Budget Attempt

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s finance minister cut spending, forecast slower growth and saw debt peaking at a slightly higher level in his third stab at a budget that had threatened the stability of the nation’s governing coalition.
title: South Africa Cuts Growth Outlook, Spending Plans in Third Budget

author: Monique Vanek
description: Below are the highlights of South Africa’s third iteration of the 2025 budget announced by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana in Cape Town on Wednesday, after two previous versions were withdrawn because of disagreements within the governing coalition over taxes.
title: Highlights of South African Finance Minister’s Reworked Budget

author: Anto Antony
description: Former United States Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said he’s more alarmed by the country’s growing budget deficit than its trade imbalances, and urged Washington to prioritize fiscal repair.
title: Mnuchin Flags US Budget Deficit as Bigger Worry Than Trade Gap

author: Paul Wallace, Beril Akman, Zainab Fattah, Joumanna Bercetche
description: Donald Trump Jr. hinted that he may run for political office and try to succeed his father as US president.
title: Trump Jr. Says ‘Maybe One Day’ He’ll Look to Succeed His Father

author: Lucy White
description: Britain’s Labour government will change one of its most unpopular policies — the cutting of a subsidy for pensioners’ energy bills — after many voters abandoned the party in a local elections earlier this month.
title: Starmer U-Turns on Signature Benefit Cut That Backfired at Polls

author: Erik Wasson, Nacha Cattan
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Republicans have reached an agreement to increase the state and local tax deduction to $40,000, suggesting a resolution to one of the final issues holding up President Donald Trump’s economic bill.
title: Johnson Says Agreement Reached on $40,000 SALT Cap Increase

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Nigeria’s top opposition leaders agreed to unite before the next election in 2027, seeking to repair rifts that handed President Bola Tinubu victory in an election two years ago.
title: Nigerian Opposition Leaders Agree to Unite Before 2027 Election

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukraine said its drones damaged a Russian semiconductor plant that it said is used to help produce fighter jets and missiles.
title: Ukraine Said It Hit Russia Chip Plant Used in Missile Production

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Israel Faces Global Isolation Over War on Gaza

author: Michal Kubala
description: The European Union is seeking to strengthen its common market in the face of rising geopolitical tensions and a growing trade conflict with the US, which is threatening to hit the bloc with wide-ranging tariffs.
title: EU Unveils Plan to Reinvigorate World’s Second-Biggest Market

author: Faris Mokhtar, Philip Heijmans
description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong unveiled his new cabinet Wednesday, opting to retain his role as finance minister following a convincing electoral victory earlier this month, CNA reported.
title: Singapore’s Wong Unveils New Cabinet, Keeps Finance Minister Job

author: Jason Leopold
description: Failures in cybersecurity practices at a software company that helps federal agencies manage investigations and FOIA requests allowed two convicted hackers to delete databases, according to internal documents.
title: Probe Found Security Lapses Led to US Contractor’s Data Breach

author: Enda Curran, Jarrell Dillard
description: The rapidly evolving outlook for US economic growth is boiling down to a tale of two tax policies.
title: Trump Import-Tax Hike Counters Income-Tax Relief, Economists Say

author: Jarrell Dillard, Erik Wasson
description: House lawmakers debated the contours of President Donald Trump’s tax cuts throughout the night as they race to meet a self-imposed deadline to approve the legislation by Thursday.
title: Congress Pulls Tax Cut All-Nighter With SALT Fight Unresolved

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Chinese automaker and Apple Inc supplier BYD is being asked to turn over its books to the House Homeland Security Committee, as part of an investigation into national security risks posed by transportation manufacturers affiliated with the ruling Chinese Communist Party, the committee told Bloomberg.
title: BYD Documents Sought by House Panel in Probe of US Electric Bus Unit

author: Chris Reiter, Karin Matussek
description: Germany arrested five people accused of participating in a right-wing terror cell that sought to attack migrants and undermine the country’s democratic system.
title: Germany Makes Arrests of Suspected Right-Wing Terrorist Cell

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s planned crackdown against civil society and media infringes on the rule of law, according to an independent group of judges.
title: Orban’s Plan to Muzzle Dissent Threatens Rule of Law, Judges Say

author: Colum Murphy
description: US-China tech tensions are flaring again, with Beijing threatening legal action against anyone enforcing Washington’s restrictions on Huawei Technologies Co.’s chips, casting a shadow over a recent trade truce and efforts to sustain dialogue.
title: US-China Tensions Over Chips Risk Hurting Trade Truce, Dialogue

author: Julian Luk, Alfred Cang
description: Chinese authorities have questioned the heads of some of the country’s leading metals merchants and producers as part of an intensifying effort to crack down on critical-minerals smuggling, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: Chinese Authorities Question Metals Bosses in Smuggling Probe

author: Rene Vollgraaff, Antony Sguazzin
description: The US president’s offer of refugee status for Afrikaners comes as his administration slashes spending that was helping Black South Africans.
title: Trump’s Genocide Claim Rakes Up South Africa’s Apartheid Past

author: Lucy White
description: Figures due on Thursday are likely to show Keir Starmer presiding over the biggest ever drop in net migration to the UK. For the prime minister, however, the hard part will be getting any credit from voters.
title: Historic Fall in UK Migration Can’t Come Fast Enough for Starmer

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: A federal judge in Boston has ordered the Trump administration to “maintain custody” of a group of migrant men who may have been deported to South Sudan on Tuesday.
title: US Deports Migrants to War-Torn South Sudan, Court Records Say

author: Colum Murphy
description: China said it could take legal action against anyone enforcing US restrictions on using Huawei Technologies Co.’s AI chips, escalating a dispute that’s upset a tentative truce on tariffs.
title: China Threatens Enforcers of US’s Huawei Curbs With Legal Action

author: Manolo Serapio Jr
description: The US and the Philippines held a new round of joint sails within Manila’s exclusive economic zone, with their coast guards participating for the first time, amid continuing tensions in the disputed South China Sea.
title: US, Philippine Coast Guards Join Navy Drills Amid China Tensions
